meanings.definition: Able to be seen or noticed.
meanings.sent1: The sound of the bell was perceptible from far away.
meanings.sent2: The faint outline of the mountain was perceptible in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to hide behind the curtain was perceptible to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The impact of her words was perceptible in the silence that followed.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking in the oven was perceptible throughout the house.

meanings.definition: Able to be heard or felt.
meanings.sent1: The vibrations from the music were perceptible in the floor.
meanings.sent2: The excitement in her voice was perceptible to all who listened.
meanings.sent3: The rumble of thunder was perceptible even with earplugs in.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was perceptible, like a thick fog hanging in the air.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the sun on her skin was perceptible and comforting.
